page.title: 07GUIDE DOG CENTRE,BOLTON
page.content: It takes three weeks to train a blind person to be able to handle a dog.They get the money from the public by donations.There are 63 staff.Some live at the centre and some are part_time.There are a hundred puppy_walkers in the North West and seven hundred and seventy guide dogs which Nuffield House are responsible for, up to 120 dogs in the centre and 650 working dogs in the area.The average age for retiring is 10 to 11,but if the dog is ill it will retire early.If a dog fails its test it will be offered to a puppy_walker or the public as a pet.The centre has 3 baths one of which is an isolation block.They have a food store they give the dogs mostly tinned food,but sometimes they get raw meat.The most popular dogs to train are golden labradors.
